value.title: Flying Killer Robot 'Hunted Down' a Human Target Without Being Instructed to, UN Experts Say
value.excerpt: A “lethal” weaponized drone “hunted down” and “remotely engaged” human targets without its handlers’ say-so during a conflict in Libya last year, according to a United Nations report first covered by New Scientist this week.

value.title: AI and robotics take centre stage in rapidly changing world
value.excerpt: Thrust five years into the future by Covid-19, as management firm McKinsey puts it, most of what we expected to see in 2030 will soon be upon us.

value.title: Retailers Ariat, Decathlon latest to adopt Exotec robotics
value.excerpt: Warehouse robotics firm Exotec announced footwear retailer Ariat and the world’s largest sporting goods retailer Decathlon will deploy its Skypod warehouse robotics system.

value.excerpt: While our facial expressions play a huge role in building trust, most robots still sport the blank and static visage of a professional poker player. With the increasing use of robots in locations where robots and humans need to work closely together,

value.title: South Korean firm to develop liability insurance for AI robots
value.excerpt: South Korean telecom giant KT is developing an insurance program covering artificial intelligence-based robotics services for the first time.

value.title: Dream Bot L10 Pro Review: A robot vacuum newcomer that cleans well
value.excerpt: The Dreame Bot L10 Pro is one of the first bots from Dreame Technology, which is looking to make a name of itself in the always competitive robot vacuum space.

value.title: Rock picking robotics startup TerraClear raises $25 million

value.title: SK partnership brings Kodiak Robotics’ autonomous technology to Asia
value.excerpt: Kodiak Robotics strikes a partnership with South Korea’s SK conglomerate to move its autonomous trucking software to Asia.

value.title: Tesla aspires to become a robotics firm in Artificial Intelligence
value.excerpt: Tesla CEO Elon Musk recently announced that the company is no longer just a manufacturer of electric cars, but that they are currently dabbling in artificial intelligence with the development of one of the strongest hardware and software AI teams in the world.

value.title: Artistic humanoid robot creates unsettling self portraits selling for big money

value.title: 4 AI Healthcare Stocks Transforming the Medical Industry
value.excerpt: An article from the Brookings Institution suggests that “whoever leads in artificial intelligence in 2030 will rule the world until 2100.” This is a big statement and underscores the importance of AI in the coming decade.

value.title: Sense of Touch Improves Control of Robotic Arm
value.excerpt: Adding a BCI that evokes tactile sensations makes it easier for users to manipulate and use robotic arm prosthetics.

value.title: Robotics Hub Carnegie Mellon Lands $150 Million Grant
value.excerpt: The university will use half of the grant to expand research and staff for its advanced manufacturing program and to build a new center focused on robotics innovation.

value.title: Mental health app Wysa raises $5.5M for ’emotionally intelligent’ AI
value.excerpt: It’s hard enough to talk about your feelings to a person; Jo Aggarwal, the founder and CEO of Wysa, is hoping you’ll find it easier to confide in a robot. Or, put more specifically, “emotionally intelligent” artificial intelligence.

value.title: New sensation: pioneering mind-controlled arm restores sense of touch
value.excerpt: Imagine being able to control a robotic arm from a distance, using only your mind. Now imagine being able to feel when its fingers grasp an object, as though it were your own hand.

value.title: Brain stimulation evoking sense of touch improves control of robotic arm
value.excerpt: Most able-bodied people take their ability to perform simple daily tasks for granted—when they reach for a warm mug of coffee, they can feel its weight and temperature and adjust their grip accordingly so that no liquid is spilled.
